page.title: 05Horse Riding in the Forest
page.content: Once a fortnight on a Saturday morning at 11 a.m. we drive up to{ {Hangersley}for a riding leson. We ride Pickles and Ajax. Pickles is a{grey {Welsh Mountain pony}and Ajax is a{ {brown and white cob.} Sometimes we ride through{Linford} and have a good canter up the hiils and through the woods. When we get back we help Mrs. Morson, the owner, clean the tack and muck out the stables. If we are lucky we are able to help the toddlers with their ponies. For riding we wear{jodhpurs}on our legs which prevent us being caught up in the saddle and being dragged if we fall. We wear a{hard hat}to protect our head. On our feet we wear long, black, rubber{riding boots.}Our hair is usually in plaits or pony tails or really neat in a net.
